Title: Associate Director, Digital Messaging - Canada - Indeed.com
Description:
Bounteous is leading the charge in dynamic digital experiences and is looking for the right team members to drive those results. In our ever-changing, fast-paced digital world, our approach helps brands envision, harness, and enable their online and mobile presence.
We are looking for an
Associate Director, Digital Messaging
to create big-picture digital solutions and deliver transformational brand experiences. This person will work within our Marketing Services team and will be responsible for helping lead our Digital Messaging channel by setting and achieving channel goals, growing our client base and developing the Digital Messaging team. If you are passionate about collaborating with curious minds to help solution complex problems then we want to hear from you!
Role and Responsibilities
Mature and expand the knowledge and thought leadership of the Bounteous Digital Messaging practice along with the supporting technology
Serve as senior subject matter expert and advisor for channel team members, and during business development pursuits
Lead a team of campaign managers and specialists to execute upon multiple digital messaging client projects
Be a leading practice advocate and evangelist within and beyond Bounteous
Prepare project plans that list tasks, milestones, timelines, deliverables, dependencies and owners
Assess team effectiveness and opportunities then formulate a plan to action against
Work with assigned account teams to support top performance and growth
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Marketing or relevant experience
Agency experience preferred but not required
Solid understanding of digital marketing & data reporting
Familiarity with at least two of the following platforms: Adobe Campaign Classic, Adobe Campaign Standard, Salesforce Marketing Cloud or other enterprise marketing platforms/ESPs.
Understanding of HTML, CSS and JavaScript preferred but not required
Passion for the digital domain and use of technology to solve business problems
Ability to learn new technologies at high level to identify use opportunities
Be self-motivated, responsive, professional, and dedicated to customer success
Possess an innovative, problem-solving, and solutions-oriented mindset
Exceptional organizational, presentation, and communication skills – both verbal and written
Understanding of customer and e-commerce data concepts, structures and use cases
Demonstrable leadership experience at team and individual level
#LI-Remote
We invite you to subscribe to our monthly and quarterly newsletters to stay up to date with the latest job openings as well as resources and tips for job seekers here.
Research shows that women and other underrepresented groups apply only if they meet 100% of the criteria of a job posting. If you have passion and intelligence, and possess a technical knack (even if you’re missing some of the above), we encourage you to apply.
Bounteous is focused on promoting an inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate the different viewpoints and experiences our diverse group of team members bring to Bounteous. Bounteous does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.
Bounteous is willing to sponsor eligible candidates for employment visas.
For employment opportunities based in Canada:
Bounteous is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace. In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, accommodation will be provided at any point throughout the hiring process, provided the candidate makes their accommodation needs known to Bounteous. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates.
**Must be legally eligible to work in Canada.

Title: Rédacteur de contenu de produit - Senneville, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Overview
Tenaquip est reconnue pour son environnement de travail amical et dynamique. Non seulement croyons-nous en l'aide apporté aux organismes de bienfaisance par la Fondation Tenaquip, mais notre programme de remboursement des frais de scolarité permet à nos employés de développer et faire évoluer leur propre carrière. Tenaquip croit en l'équilibre entre la vie et le travail, c'est pourquoi nous offrons 21 jours de congé payé au cours de l'année. Sans compter notre programme de participation aux bénéfices!
Responsibilities
Le Rédacteur de contenu de produit est responsable de recueillir et formater les informations des catalogues et des sites web des fournisseurs afin de rédiger des descriptions et titres de produits efficaces et complets. Travaillant en collaboration avec les équipes de la gestion des catégories, du web ainsi que numériques, cette personne travaille sur des mots-clés et synonymes pour améliorer les résultats de recherche et aussi assiste à la révision du contenu des sites web pour le contrôle de qualité et loptimisation SEO.
Qualifications
Si vous avez dexcellentes habiletés de communication, de lexpérience dans la rédaction de copie de produits pour le commerce électronique et une connaissance fonctionnelle des meilleures pratiques SEO, ce poste est pour vous. Nous recherchons un candidat ayant des connaissances dans le secteur de industriel et de la sécurité et possédant de solides compétences en gestion des priorités
Work Experience
1 à 2 années dexpérience dans un domaine connexe.
Employment Level
Full-time
Eligibility Statement
Nous sommes un employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité de l'accès à l'emploi. Nous apprécions tout intérêt à joindre notre équipe, mais seulement les candidats sélectionnés pour une entrevue seront contactés.

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist - Ottawa, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Title:
Digital Marketing Specialist
Department:
Marketing
Reports to:
Director, Content Marketing
Term:
Full-Time Continuing
Primary Location:
505 March Road, Kanata, ON
Evidence Partners is a successful, Ottawa-based software company in the life sciences field. Evidence partners is dedicated to positively impacting the future of evidence-based research by helping our users conduct high quality systematic literature reviews faster and more efficiently.
The Product
DistillerSR is a SaaS platform that is used globally by researchers, pharmaceutical companies, medical device companies, governments, NGOs, and academic institutions to deliver life changing evidence-based research faster and more efficiently. Our software combines proprietary data management, workflow, and AI technologies that are fundamentally changing the way researchers conduct systematic literature reviews.
The Role
Reporting to the Director, Content Marketing, the position is responsible for executing and optimizing Evidence Partner’s B2B digital marketing programs. Proficiency in SEO/SEM, social media marketing, website management and reporting a must along with knowledge of a wide range of B2B digital marketing practices, concepts, and procedures.
Duties and Responsibilities
Execute and optimize our B2B programs and campaigns.
Administer public website, maintain consistent web design and optimize performance.
Support the development of integrated, media objectives for cross-channel digital media plans. and campaign execution that address campaign objectives, and deliver business impact.
Carry out post-campaign analysis and post-mortems to provide insights and recommendations on how to optimize and improve effectiveness.
Equip business teams and internal stakeholders with data-driven insights to make fact-based decisions while deriving customer insights from digital analytics datasets.
Design, build, maintain and validate digital analytics dashboards using data visualization tools to systematically analyze customer behavior and traffic trends.
Provide guidance on emerging martech capabilities spanning platforms, content production and distribution (content marketing, SEM/PPC, marketing automation, SEO, benchmarking, media plan design, etc.), and measurement (analytics, dashboarding, reporting, etc.)
Note: Duties are not limited to those listed above. Additional duties may be assigned as required. However, reasonable accommodations will be made if all possible under business conditions.
Skills & Qualifications (Education and Experience)
In-depth marketing automation and CRM experience, ideally with Hubspot.
Demonstrated success in ABM, SEO/SEM, email marketing, social media marketing, demand generation, and other digital marketing tactics.
In-depth knowledge of WordPress, HTML and CSS.
Conducted A/B tests (ex: Optimizely, Monetate, Adobe target.)
Experience with Microsoft’s PowerBI or Google Data Studio.
Experience with Google Analytics & Google Ads (Certification Preferred).
Excellent analytical and project management skills.
An ability to multitask and perform under tight deadlines.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Must be an excellent team player.
We are an equal opportunity employer, dedicated and committed to recruiting and selecting applicants on the basis of their qualifications. We strive to increase our diversity and encourage applications from all candidates that meet any of our requirements. Evidence Partners does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, gender, disability, age, or other protected statuses. We are focused on equality and believe that increasing diversity of thought and lived experience makes us stronger together.

Title: Marketing Coordinator - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Summary:
Function Point is looking for a Marketing Coordinator with a growth hacker mindset to join our team to drive customer acquisition.
This role will report to the Marketing Manager. You will work closely with them to take charge of all inbound and outbound marketing initiatives to increase visitors and drive conversion at each step on the funnel, optimize digital programs, develop lead nurture strategies, and assist in marketing automation activities.
In your role, you will collaborate cross-functionally with the sales and customer success teams to assist in creating campaigns to drive customer success and generate & nurture new leads. You will also work in coordination with external agency teams to ensure strategic initiatives – content, design, collateral, campaigns- are executed on time and in line with the company’s marketing and strategic goals.
This role is a great opportunity to hone and grow your marketing career in the software/SaaS industry!
Job Description:
Who we are:
Function Point is an all-in-one agency management software solution designed to boost the productivity and profitability of creative agencies. We are a B2B SaaS organization which is part of the Volaris Group, an operating group of Constellation Software, Inc.
Our Mission
and Culture
Our mission -
"Allowing creative agencies to focus on what they do best, being creative"
- is underpinned by Function Point's 4 Core Values;
People Obsessed, Customer Centered, Ownership
,
and
Trust
.
Our Culture start s with understanding our customers better than anyone in the industry, we are able to create a positive customer experience as we adapt our strategies to their changing needs.
We are a fun, collaborative, and close-knit team that loves what we do and where help and support are always available ; we value smart, respectful, out of the box thinkers that want to be leaders in contact industry disruption!
Responsibilities:
Assist with the development, management, and implementation of online marketing strategies and campaigns to meet sales, acquisition, and retention goals
Assist in execut ing product go-to-market plans including individual product launches in collaboration with sales, success and product teams
Assist in driving optimization through A/B tests and experiments
Monitor , track, and report on key results for all marketing campaigns and initiatives
Build and own social media strategy for FP and its product offerings
Develop monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting and analytics for website, social media, SEO and marketing automation platforms
Work collaboratively with internal and external teams to create relevant content for prospects and customers , and enablement collateral for internal teams
Manage, and optimize digital advertising strategies and budget spend
You will thrive in this role if you:
Are a self-starter who takes action , is eager to learn , and passionate about their work
Have previous experience in project management and delivery
You enjoy working both autonomously and collaboratively within a team , in a fast-paced environment
Have experience working in small to medium size enterprises and/or in the B2B SaaS /technology space
Have a basic understanding of Google Analytics and email marketing/automation
Have 1 to 3 years' experience working in a marketing role ( preferably as a generalist )
Have an undergraduate degree in marketing, digital marketing, advertising, or in a related field
Bonus points if:
You have experience with marketing automation tools such as Marketo
You have experience with content writing and digital design (Photoshop, InDesign, CANVA, etc )
You have an understanding of SEO, content marketing, digital advertising (GDN, LinkedIn , etc ), performance marketing tactics
Perks @
FP
Competitive salary
Work from home
A comprehensive h ealth and b enefits program
Professional development opportunities
Do you picture yourself in this environment?
Introduce yourself by telling us why this opportunity will fit your ambitions and how you can contribute to the future growth of our business , in a cover letter (1-page) and resume highlighting your achievements.
We’re excited to meet you!
Please note:
You m ust be eligible to work in Canada
This is a 100% remote opportunity
Your inquiry is in complete confidence
Worker Type:
Regular
Number of Openings Available:
0
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Search Engine Optimization (SEO) Specialist - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
The SEO Specialist is an SEO expert capable of analyzing clients' digital properties and implementing changes (on and off-site) to improve their SEO. He/she is responsible for executing SEO improvement initiatives (writing SEO-optimized content, implementing
link building
initiatives, etc., and tracking SEO metrics), and the monitoring of associated performance indicators.
Compensation:
$70,000 - $80,000 yearly
Responsibilities:
Understand the strategic issues of clients in terms of digital content and SEO improvement.
Contribute to the analysis of SEO audits and the implementation of the natural referencing strategy (on-site, off-site and technical) of clients.
Conduct keyword research, analysis and optimization required for the execution of SEO mandates.
Performing competitive audits necessary for the execution of SEO copywriting mandates.
Plan and execute
link building
Write digital content (website, landing page, blog) optimized for SEO.
Take care of local SEO mandates (Google My Business).
Set up dashboards to monitor SEO key performance indicators.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in writing, digital marketing, or other relevant field.
3 to 5 years experience in SEO, ideally in an agency.
Impeccable grammar and spelling in both French and English.
Ability to work simultaneously and efficiently on multiple projects.
Comfortable with SEO tools such as Google Search Console, Google Keyword Planner, SEM Rush, Moz, etc.
Bilingual English/French.
About Company
Empower is an application that takes care of all the marketing needs of small and medium businesses through a fun interface encouraging marketing actions through automation and human experts.
We hire professionals who are eager to learn, grow, and help businesses in all industries succeed. We offer competitive salaries and benefits and our employees have the freedom to work anywhere in the world (or from any WeWork office) alongside a collaborative team, excellence, honesty, and fun!

Title: Optimization Specialist, Digital Marketing - Edmonton, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
AMA:
A DIGITAL
house
IS YOUR
domain
.
Posted: 2021-11-19
Closing: When Filled
Location: Edmonton South
To you, research, testing and analysis of website traffic, consumer behavior, and general business metrics isn’t work — it’s what makes you tick! You’re a research machine and you thrive on making meaningful recommendations to address relevant business challenges. You’re game — there is no research project too big or small. At the Alberta Motor Association (AMA), we truly appreciate the value of our members, and we want their AMA digital experience to be purposeful and memorable. To better achieve this, we’re looking for a Optimization Specialist to test, research and analyze . Does this sound like you?
WHAT MOVES YOU
You love to share thoughts and ideas – after all, two heads are better than one.
You're creative and resourceful and enjoy working with data to measure and analyze online consumer behavior.
You 'get' what it means to be part of the team.
You manage your time as expertly as you manage your projects. Prioritizing, planning and organizing are part of your DNA.
You enjoy talking about marketing tactics, advertising and search engine optimization.
You're 'web-savvy' and current on Internet trends, tools and technologies.
You're a natural at finding business solutions through detailed research and analytics and presenting them to others.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
You will report to the Team Lead, Marketing Operations.
Interpret data from a variety of sources, conduct analysis and offer meaningful and relevant recommendations that address and respond to business needs and challenges.
Lead the design, implementation, and analysis of digital experiments
Develop personalization and site optimization strategies to drive conversion across all major lead/sales funnels
Perform detailed analysis and report results across programs, campaigns and segments and make actionable recommendations for improvement.
Continually test and optimize existing campaigns to identify areas of improvement
Ensure reliable digital measurement, analysis, and optimization information through the implementation of Google Analytics, Google AdWords, Optimizely and other digital marketing tools.
Develop in-depth reporting to provide meaningful visibility into AMA’s business lines.
Use member data and behaviors to research and analyze business trends to identify new opportunities.
Perform multivariate or A/B tests to improve the member experience and optimize the performance of AMA’s online properties.
Establish measures of success (KPIs) for monitoring and testing through sequential, A/B and multivariate testing.
Set up and and maintain Google Analytics and Tag Manager.
Utilize Google Analytics dashboard for site tracking and to perform regular maintenance.
Work closely with AMA business units to develop custom scheduled and ad hoc reports to meet their information requirements - after all, it's all about the end user experience!
WHAT YOU’VE DONE
You have a university degree or post-secondary diploma in a related field such as computer science or marketing. Have a degree in something else? Tell us about it and how you can use it in this role.
You have a minimum of 3 years' experience in delivering conversion testing and optimization.
You already have extensive experience working with shared web analytics tools such as Google Analytics,
You also really know your way around advanced web analytics/methodologies, such as experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, surveys, and market research.
Previous marketing experience would be an asset.
WHAT YOU'LL GET
Competitive salary
Flexible benefits.
Outstanding employer-paid pension plan.
Great AMA discounts.
Unlimited learning opportunities.
Vacation time and floater day
Please note, this position will be working from home during the pandemic.
We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Digital Marketing Intern - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Berg Chilling Systems designs, manufactures, installs, and services custom industrial thermal process control systems for a broad range of industries and specialized applications around the world. For more than 45 years, Berg continues to satisfy customers with 5,000 chilling systems in more than 30 industries across 50 countries.
From our Toronto-based facility, we design, manufacture, test, and integrate skid-mounted process refrigeration equipment, mechanical packages, and fluid pumping systems using both natural and HFC refrigerants for ease of installation and commissioning.
We currently have a co-op opportunity at our Toronto, ON head office and manufacturing facility for a Marketing Assistant Co-op, reporting to the Marketing Manager.
The ideal candidate will:
Execute and assist in marketing projects under the supervision of the Marketing Manager, including new lead generation, digital advertising, website updates, and content development.
Develop and conduct email marketing campaigns.
Prepare marketing reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing marketing data
Stay current in constantly evolving digital marketing best practices, trends, and new technology and applications, leading the implementation of agreed solutions.
Other marketing and business development duties as required.
Experience & Qualifications
Minimum 1 year of relevant experience
Bachelor’s degree and/or postgraduate certificate in marketing (in progress)
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Experience with WordPress CMS and HTML
Knowledge of SEO principles is an asset
Experience with Google Analytics and SEMRush an asset
Proficiency in Microsoft Windows and Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Excellent organizational skills and strong attention to detail
Capability to work effectively both independently, and closely with others in a small team environment.
If you are entrepreneurial, professional, want to contribute to the success of a growth-focused company, and a team player that thrives on challenges in a fun, fast-paced environment, this is the opportunity for you.
If you think you are a perfect fit for this role,
please send your resume to
marketing@berg-group.com
with the subject line “Marketing Co-op Position”.
Please include your co-op availability (4 months or 8 months).
Equal Opportunity Employer
At Berg Chilling Systems, we welcome diversity and the synergy stemming from all perspectives as a result of different At Berg Chilling Systems, we welcome diversity and the synergy stemming from all perspectives because of different backgrounds and experiences. We provide respect and equal employment opportunities for all Company individuals and applicants for positions regardless of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, age, record of offences, marital status, same-sex partnership status, family status and disability.
Thank you for your interest in Berg Chilling Systems, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Marketing Coordinator - Richmond, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Fitness World is a gym for everyone. Convenient locations with new affordable memberships at a lower cost that give members access to the best of the best in fitness. We’re creating an amazing environment where every member can crush their fitness goals.
Position Summary:
Fitness World is looking for a self-motivated, highly organized Marketing Coordinator to assist with all aspects of the strategic marketing plan, from social media to events, and everything in between. This role will have a strong focus on growing Fitness World’s online brand presence through content creation and social media engagement, and will support Fitness World’s day-to-day marketing tasks.
Reporting to the Senior Marketing Manager, this position is an amazing opportunity for a high performing individual to be part of the full rebrand of BC’s largest fitness provider, plus get unparalleled experience in all aspects of marketing from digital campaigns and e-commerce to local store marketing, events and member experience initiatives.
Responsibilities:
Plan and execute marketing campaigns online and in-club and assist in the development and implementation of an effective brand strategy
Create and curate engaging photo and video content for social media, including maintaining content calendar and identifying new opportunities for social content
Work closely with the graphic designer to create engaging imagery for social media
Liaise with external agencies for digital marketing and social media initiatives, as well as promotional partners and suppliers
Support clubs in Local Store Marketing initiatives and in-club execution of marketing campaigns
Assist in inventory tracking and carry out administrative tasks, as needed
Perform competitive analysis and research on industry trends, as needed
Maintain weekly and monthly reporting on marketing initiatives
Qualifications:
Previous experience in marketing or communications
Previous experience in content creation, photography, video editing
Post-Secondary education in a discipline relevant to marketing or communications
Organization skills and the ability to multi-task and work under pressure to meet tight deadlines
Drive to succeed and willingness to creatively problem solve
Exceptional written communication skills
Strong knowledge of MS Office
Experience with Adobe Creative Suite an asset
Familiarity with HubSpot an asset
Valid Class 5 Driver’s License and willingness to travel locally to club locations
Fitness World Perks:
Competitive Pay & Paid Vacation
Group Benefits (dental, extended health & travel)
Complimentary Membership & Discounted Personal Training for You and One Other

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist - Calgary, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
Athabasca Minerals is a dynamic, growing, publicly traded company looking for a part-time Digital Marketing Specialist to support our various business units. This role would initially be a part-time position with the potential to convert to full-time employment. In this role the successful candidate would be responsible for supporting the various Corporate divisions with their marketing, social media, video presentations and other branding requirements. The ideal candidate will have experience in multiple marketing streams and experience working in a publicly traded company is desirable but not required.
Position Requirements:
Experience with various design software
2 years of experience in marketing or advertising department
Post-secondary degree or diploma in communications or marketing
Ability to research and understand ways to penetrate new markets
Disciplined self-starter who can work both on their own and in close collaboration with other team members in an agile working environment
Fast learner
Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Office: Word, Publisher, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook are required
Elite written and verbal communication abilities
Experience in the aggregates industry is an asset
Search Engine Optimization experience
Experience in video and audio production
Roles and Responsibilities:
Website Management including: Updating content (banners, blogs); create & edit web pages; update website product stock
Digital Marketing including: Create & manage Google Ads; website analytics
Social Media Management (Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn)
Creation and implementation of video presentations, webinars, etc.
Assist in newsletter creation
Working Environment:
Flexible working hours
Option to work from home
Competitive salary and benefits
Friendly and supportive team environment
Opportunity to join a company with aggressive plans for expansion
Athabasca is an integrated group of companies focused on the aggregates, industrial minerals and resource sectors, driven by technology to bring improved value to industry and our customers. Our business is comprised of 4 distinct, but synergetic, divisions that include:
AMI Aggregates
- produces and sells aggregate out of its corporate pits and manages the Coffey Lake Public Pit on behalf of the Province of Alberta.
AMI Silica
- positioning to become a leading supplier of premium domestic silica sand with regional deposits in Alberta and NE British Columbia.
AMI RockChain
- a midstream technology-based business using its proprietary RockChain™ digital platform, associated algorithm, and quality assurance & control services to provide cost-effective integrated supply / delivery solutions of industrial minerals to industry, and the construction sector.
TerraShift Engineering Ltd.
- offers technology-based applications that support resource exploration and development, engineering services, environmental and regulatory planning, resource management, compliance reporting, and reclamation for a growing customer base.
Athabasca Minerals is an equal opportunity employer offering a competitive compensation package. We thank all candidates for applying, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted, no phone calls please.
To apply for this position please submit your resume and cover letter. We thank all candidates for applying, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted, no phone calls please.

Title: Digital Marketing & Communications Specialist (with experience in the Education Industry) - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
About Us
Since 1936 Columbia College has offered quality educational programs to prepare students for university admission. These programs include a university transfer program fully integrated into the BC Transfer System, a secondary program certified by the Province of British Columbia, and a full-time Academic Preparatory English Program accredited by Languages Canada. Thousands of Canadian and international students have progressed through Columbia's programs to successful Canadian universities.
The Opportunity
We are seeking a creative Digital Marketing and Communications Specialist talented individual who will be the key driver of executing our College's marketing plan on print, digital, and social media platforms. This is a hybrid full-time position (35 hours p/week).
The digital professional will bring their knowledge and experience in the education industry to this role.
Our ideal candidate is a proactive and creative quick learner with online marketing experience, able to execute our digital marketing strategy on social media and online media to reach prospective students and international markets.
The Digital Marketing and Communications Specialist plays a pivotal role in supporting tactical communication for existing and prospective students and works to enhance the visibility and reputation of the College locally and internationally. This position will collaborate with members of the Student Services, Recruitment team, and the Executive Director to update the College website, create specific projects and campaigns that promote the College's brand and programs.
The Specialist reports and works under the Director of Recruitment, Admissions and Marketing direction. Functional direction may be provided by the Student Services Manager and the Executive Director.
Key Responsibilities
Overseeing the College's online presence, including maintaining and updating of the
College's website, social media accounts, search engine optimization, and other digital
marketing projects.
Creating, monitoring and updating the website content in a timely, consistent, efficient
manner.
Creating and implementing strategic communication plans.
Collaborating with the Recruitment and the Student Services departments
implementing communication objectives; and implementing tactics, timelines, and
evaluation.
Implementing communication projects in all the different digital platforms.
Preparing communication analysis reports from a variety of sources (e.g. social media
analytics, surveys, Google Analytics) to determine the effectiveness of communication
plans and makes recommendations for future improvements.
Developing marketing communications content and materials strategy, ensuring that all
tactical solutions align with Columbia College's marketing and communications plans.
Implementing client-focused marketing initiatives to drive the growth of the College,
generating and customizing marketing toolkits and multimedia presentations for
Columbia College clients to support advertising and student recruitment efforts.
Managing relationships with service providers, including designers, web developers,
printers, photographers, etc.
Maintaining Columbia College's brand presence through systematic social media
campaigns, development of media/press releases, and communication to existing and
prospective partners.
Developing and posting marketing communications content and materials, ensuring that
all tactical solutions align with Columbia College's marketing and communications plans.
Organizing, prioritizing and scheduling content distribution on social media, digital
signage, blog, and other communication tools.
Ensuring accuracy of content by coordinating workflow and collaborating with College
members, including employees, students and others.
Researching, organizing information and performing interviews for internal and external
communications.
Ideal Candidate
A marketing talent who loves to be at the forefront of an emerging market to promote a
new concept and product.
A proactive, agile, resilient, quick learner with a candid and flexible attitude.
A high-performing individual with experience working with teams and other
stakeholders through challenging projects in the education sector
An innovative and thoughtful marketer with a hands-on attitude
Excited about new technologies that have the potential to give every student, no matter
where they live, the opportunity to get an excellent education
Qualifications and Requirements:
3 to 5 years of experience in digital marketing and communications.
Bachelor's degree in Commerce, Business, Marketing, Communications or related fields.
Strong organization and project management skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial, highly demanding environment.
Ability to effectively convey key messages and accurately provide essential information
to a variety of stakeholders.
Experience and knowledge in the education sector would be an asset
Excellent goal-driven marketing skills.
Deep understanding of all social media platforms and demonstrated social media
expertise to engage audiences.
Ability to work effectively and diplomatically with diverse campus audiences and
external agencies.
Advanced knowledge and working experience of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, WordPress,
Adobe Cloud, Print Media, Content Management Systems, Graphics Design applications,
and Social Media products.
Ability to communicate effectively with excellent oral and written communication skills
and a high level of proficiency in English grammar.
Ability to work effectively independently and in a team environment.
Ability to set priorities, be detail-oriented, and work well under pressure to meet
deadlines.
Ability to recognize, respect and work effectively with individuals and groups with
diverse perspectives and backgrounds.
Takes the initiative in learning about language and issues relating to equity and diversity
Committed to demonstrating respect to colleagues at every level by trusting in their
abilities.
Models and demonstrates good communication through active listening, appreciative
inquiry, and openness to providing and receiving timely, constructive feedback.
Salary
Columbia College offers a competitive salary. This position's starting full-time salary range is

Title: Senior Web Developer, Digital Marketing, iA Wealth - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Maternity Leave Contract (17 months)
Position overview and responsibilities
The Senior Web Developer, Digital Marketing will work collaboratively across various teams, supporting digital activity, using best in class tools to ensure success across web development and campaign delivery, including its performance. Reporting to the Senior Digital Marketing Manager, iA Wealth, the Senior Web Developer, Digital Marketing is responsible for creating templates and features (e.g. digital metrics, data integration, etc.), investigating and fixing existing problems, improving the code base, writing acceptance testing cases, as well as implementing new technologies. This role is key in working with internal and external resources to bridge the gap between design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works.
Key responsibilities:
Knowledge of CMS and digital marketing platforms, and how to implement such requirements in line with other iA Wealth and iA Financial Group technologies
Build and maintain front-end code / JSON API integrations for a variety of internal and external digital channels
Work on front-end development activities, solutions, methods, and practices
Develop new and effective interactive and responsive GUI solutions on time and in scope
Develop and maintain email marketing templates for use in marketing automation software, as well as Outlook
Collaborate with team to deliver on new business initiatives and platform enhancements
Support the relationship with third party developers, provide in-house QA, ensure deliverables received on time and meet specifications
Develop and enforce methodologies, standards, documentation and best practices for the group
Setup project development environments and supervise deployments with release notes
Research and recommend appropriate interactive technologies
Develop reusable code libraries; maintain source control
Prepare and execute demos and training sessions on the technical solution
Conduct code walkthroughs and quality assurance with other development teams
Advise on the technical solution, while owning the implementation
Develop WCAG 2.0 accessible code and frameworks for AODA compliant digital experiences
Development and implementation of all website metrics tracking scripts and custom reporting dashboards with Google Analytics, Sitefinty DEC and any digital analytics tools
Knowledge, experience, skills and expertise
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or relevant technical education
5+ years of experience with website development, focusing on front-end / CMS technologies, in the public online space is required
Experience designing and building business and data layers and functional libraries
Experience with creating and consuming web services
Understanding of object-oriented design and development
Knowledge of agile principles – scrum, backlog, etc.
Fluency in data privacy requirements, ( PIPEDA, CASL, GDPR) and other jurisdiction mandate
Knowledge of ALM tools (Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, Git, etc.)
HTML 5, CSS 3/GIT/SASS, JavaScript, jQuery, CSS Grid frameworks, Bootstrap and responsive design experience required
Proficiency with Visual Studio, C# .NET using MVC / Razor templates. Knowledge of multi-platform delivery strategies required (desktop, mobile, tablet)
Proficiency with cross browser issues, Digital Accessibility and SEO experience is preferred
Familiarity with Adobe Creative Suite, especially Photoshop and Indesign for adapting design templates to web designs
Familiarity with CRM platforms
Full-stack development experience is required
Understanding of JSON and REST as it pertains to web APIs
Understanding of server and client-side caching technologies.
Strong experience with Sitefinity or other MVC .NET CMS systems.
Strong experience with Kendo UI framework and asset.
Understanding of Cloud API / Applications in an Azure Environment, Act-On Email Management, Google Analytics, Microsoft Office, Absorb LMS and with proprietary CRMs
Windows web hosting / cloud hosting technology experience with Azure an asset
Experience working within entrepreneurial fast paced environment preferred
Ability to self-manage web projects with multiple tasks and switch priorities and focuses as needed
Ability to work well in an integrated team environment
Detail oriented individual with the ability to see things holistically
Data driven, strategic thinker with excellent problem solving and communication skills
Drive and commitment to deliver a high-quality service to internal stakeholders
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Company Overview
About
iA Financial Group is the strength of a company with a human side, with its over 8,000 employees. Together, we have earned the trust of our more than four million clients and 25,000 advisors who have chosen us for their insurance, savings, and wealth management.
With over $200 billion in assets and half a billion invested in technological innovation, we’re a key player in the financial services industry in Canada and the United States. The secret to our success? Investing in you, one person at a time. Because, for over 125 years, we have believed that it’s by supporting our employees and surrounding ourselves with the most reputable leaders in the industry, we will continue to innovate.
At iA, we’re invested in you.
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
At iA Financial Group, we support and celebrate diversity. We strive to provide a workplace that is recognized as inclusive for all, regardless of ethnic origin, nationality, language, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, family situation, or physical or mental disability.
